blog.title: *winkwonk*
blog.description: This blog is an AUTOMATED blog that uses an IFTTT algorithm to instantly post fics posted under the relationship: Kim Namjoon | RM/Kim Seokjin | Jin tag on ao3. The owner of this blog (hoseokie-jung) only logs in to delete things that don't belong (rp requests, other ships, etc) once every couple of months because she has a terrible memory and forgets that this is, in fact, her blog.

title: Paint it Red
body:

by TaeTae_23

Jungkook is Rome’s most feared Gladiator.

Taehyung was just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

title: Your Biggest Fan
body:
BTS au one-shot

Namjoon x Reader Y/N

Fluff

Word Count: 1,526

A/N: You’re a famous idol and Joon is your biggest fan. @begonia-babe comes up with the ideas and I just turn them into fics 💜

gif by @rapnamu

“What’s your name, sweetie?” you ask leaning over the table so your eyes are level with the young girl on the other side.

“I’m Jiyoo,” she says in a small voice and looks shyly down at the picture in her hands. “You’re really pretty.”

You feel your heart melt and your face breaks out into a warm smile. “Thank you,” you say. “That’s really sweet of you. Would you like me to sign your picture?”

The little girl nods and flashes a small grin as she holds up your picture for you to take. It takes some control to keep from grimacing as you meet your own eyes. The picture is an older one. From when you first debuted. Back before you knew anything about working your good angles and not looking absolutely constipated. Unable to bear looking at yourself any longer, you swipe the sharpie in your hand across the bottom corner of the picture in a long arch to form the first letter of your practiced signature then write the rest of the letters and punctuate it with a cute little heart. Then you smile brightly again as you slide the picture back to the little girl.

“Here you go, Jiyoo,” you say. “I hope you have a good rest of your day.”

“I will now!” she exclaims before running the short distance to the steps leading off the stage and scampering down them. You watch for a second, the grin still on your face as your little fan makes her way excitedly to her parents. Then you look away quickly again to meet the eyes of the next fan in line.

The boy’s height catches you off guard and your eyes trail up his long torso before finally meeting his own. He has to be at least 6 feet tall. A good five inches taller than you and several more with you sitting behind the table.

“Hi,” he cracks as he runs a hand nervously through his lavender colored hair.

You can’t keep from smiling in amusement at how cute and nervous he sounds. It’s still so weird to see the affect you have on people. No one seems to believe you when you tell them that you’re just a normal girl that likes normal things but just happens to also be a member of the most popular Kpop girl group in the world. Okay, maybe their reactions do make sense. But it’s still crazy to you.

“I’m Namjoon,” he says, this time his voice sounding much more steady. It’s deep, smooth, pleasant.

“Nice to meet you, Namjoon,” you say and extend your hand. “I’m Y/N.”

He reaches out and takes it, his skin clammy but warm. “I know,” he says and you smile. Ninety-five percent of the time, that’s the response you get but it still makes your heart skip a beat. To think that hundreds of thousands—maybe millions—know your name still just blows your mind. You should be used to it by now, but you don’t think you ever will be. “I just wanted to say, Y/N, that your music and your message means a lot to me.” You can only stare at him as he goes on. “It’s helped me through a lot of really dark times and I just wanted to thank you personally for all you’ve done. For me and for your other fans too.”

His words have caught you completely off-guard and you stumble over your own. “Um…you’re welcome,” you say. “I’m glad I could help you. And I hope I can continue to.”

Namjoon smiles. It’s then that you realize you’re still holding hands and you carefully drop your own from his.

“Can I tell you something a bit embarrassing?” he asks as red tinges the tips of his ears.

You stomach drops for a second. Great, now he’s going to tell you that he does something weird like sleep with a lock of your hair under his pillow or something. You’ve heard it all.

“Sure,” you say carefully and brace yourself for whatever odd fetish he’s about to disclose.

“I…kind of run a bit of a fanfic blog on tumblr. And I promised my followers I would try to see if I could get a picture with you.”

You feel relief wash over you at the confession. Fanfic is the least of your worries when it comes to your fans. It used to bother you in the past but you’ve become used to the idea of people placing you and other idols into their own stories. Sure, some—okay most—are downright vulgar but you’ve come to expect it. Being an idol has taught you to have a thick skin. In fact, you’ve spent many nights on Tumblr diving down the rabbit hole that is idol fanfic. There are actually many blogs you follow whose fics you read regularly.

You smile warmly at Namjoon and nod. “Of course I’ll take a picture with you,” you say. “I wouldn’t want to disappoint your followers.”

Namjoon’s own mouth lifts into a wide grin, revealing two deep dimples that make your heart flutter. This boy is so cute. “Would you be okay with holding up this sign I made with my blog name on it?”

“Of course!”

When he hands you the decorated piece of paper, your eyes glance down to read the name and you let out a gasp.

“No way,” you say. “You’re joonxidol?”

All color drains from Namjoon’s face and his jaw drops. It takes several seconds for him to find his voice again. “Uh…yeah,” he says.

“Oh my gosh!” you yell causing the other members and fans in line to look your way. “I’ve read all your fics!”

The boy looks terrified. “Are you serious?”

“Your serial zombie fic is amazing!” you continue. “Though a bit unrealistic if I’m being honest.” At last color returns to his skin and keeps going until he’s beet red. “I mean, I appreciate the fact that you’ve made me into such a fierce survivalist but in reality, I’d probably be the first to die. But, I mean, thanks for the vote of confidence!” Then you stiffen as you remember another of your favorites. “Oh! And your Fading Memories one shot was so beautiful. Super deep and poetic. I cried through the whole thing. I think I’ve read it like a hundred times already.”

The whole time you’re rambling on, Namjoon is staring at you in disbelief, his jaw slack and his eyes wide. When you notice this, your words begin to trail off. Crap, you broke him.

“Uh…sorry,” you apologize. “I think I got a little too excited.”

At last, Namjoon shakes his head hard. “No, no, it’s okay. I’m just—I think I’m having an out of body experience or maybe I just had a seizure or something. I thought you just said that you read my fics.”

You smile and give a sharp nod. “I do. And you’re really talented.”

“You do?” he whispers.

You nod.

“I am?”

You giggle as you pick the sign back up from where you dropped it on the table in your excitement. “Picture?” you ask him and he quickly nods before stumbling around the table to get to you.

You press your cheek against his and rest one arm on his back while the other holds the sign. Then, with a quivering hand, Namjoon holds his phone up and takes the selfie.

“Thank you so much,” he says with a huge dimpled grin.

You take his hand again and hold it between yours. “No, thank you!” you say. “Never stop writing. I look forward to reading more of your work.” Then you hold up the sign. “Can I keep this?” you ask him. He gives you a shy nod. “Would you mind signing it for me?”

Again, Namjoon’s face goes blank but then he looks down at the sharpie you hold out to him and he comes to life again.

“I’d love to,” he says and takes the pen.

You watch as he signs his name sloppily and with a shaky hand before handing it back to you.

“I’m glad to have met you, Namjoon,” you say. Your cheeks hurt from smiling so much but you can’t help it.

“You too,” he says still in a state of disbelief before he makes his way off the stage in a daze.

*****

That night, you stumble into your hotel room utterly exhausted. Nothing sounds better than a shower and a fifteen hour nap and once you’ve bathed, you settle into your king size bed. But you can’t fall asleep just yet. Instead, you pick up your phone off your nightstand. The screen glows with a harsh light and it takes a few seconds for your eyes to adjust to the brightness. Your thumb swipes across your screen until you find Tumblr App. Then you scroll through the people you follow until you find Namjoon’s blog. Your mouth twitches into a smile when you see the title of a new one shot. “Your Biggest Fan”. Then you sink deeper into your blankets and start reading.
body_abstract:
BTS au one-shot

Namjoon x Reader Y/N

Fluff

Word Count: 1,526

A/N: You’re a famous idol and Joon is your biggest fan. @begonia-babe comes up with the ideas and I just turn them into fics 💜

gif by @rapnamu

“What’s your name, sweetie?” you ask leaning over the table so your eyes are level with the young girl on the other side.

“I’m Jiyoo,” she says in a small voice and looks shyly down at the picture in her hands. “You’re really pretty.”

You feel your heart melt and your face breaks out into a warm smile. “Thank you,” you say. “That’s really sweet of you. Would you like me to sign your picture?”

reblog.comment:
BTS au one-shot

Namjoon x Reader Y/N

Fluff

Word Count: 1,526

A/N: You’re a famous idol and Joon is your biggest fan. @begonia-babe comes up with the ideas and I just turn them into fics 💜

gif by @rapnamu

“What’s your name, sweetie?” you ask leaning over the table so your eyes are level with the young girl on the other side.

“I’m Jiyoo,” she says in a small voice and looks shyly down at the picture in her hands. “You’re really pretty.”

You feel your heart melt and your face breaks out into a warm smile. “Thank you,” you say. “That’s really sweet of you. Would you like me to sign your picture?”

[[MORE]]

The little girl nods and flashes a small grin as she holds up your picture for you to take. It takes some control to keep from grimacing as you meet your own eyes. The picture is an older one. From when you first debuted. Back before you knew anything about working your good angles and not looking absolutely constipated. Unable to bear looking at yourself any longer, you swipe the sharpie in your hand across the bottom corner of the picture in a long arch to form the first letter of your practiced signature then write the rest of the letters and punctuate it with a cute little heart. Then you smile brightly again as you slide the picture back to the little girl.

“Here you go, Jiyoo,” you say. “I hope you have a good rest of your day.”

“I will now!” she exclaims before running the short distance to the steps leading off the stage and scampering down them. You watch for a second, the grin still on your face as your little fan makes her way excitedly to her parents. Then you look away quickly again to meet the eyes of the next fan in line.

The boy’s height catches you off guard and your eyes trail up his long torso before finally meeting his own. He has to be at least 6 feet tall. A good five inches taller than you and several more with you sitting behind the table.

“Hi,” he cracks as he runs a hand nervously through his lavender colored hair.

You can’t keep from smiling in amusement at how cute and nervous he sounds. It’s still so weird to see the affect you have on people. No one seems to believe you when you tell them that you’re just a normal girl that likes normal things but just happens to also be a member of the most popular Kpop girl group in the world. Okay, maybe their reactions do make sense. But it’s still crazy to you.

“I’m Namjoon,” he says, this time his voice sounding much more steady. It’s deep, smooth, pleasant.

“Nice to meet you, Namjoon,” you say and extend your hand. “I’m Y/N.”

He reaches out and takes it, his skin clammy but warm. “I know,” he says and you smile. Ninety-five percent of the time, that’s the response you get but it still makes your heart skip a beat. To think that hundreds of thousands—maybe millions—know your name still just blows your mind. You should be used to it by now, but you don’t think you ever will be. “I just wanted to say, Y/N, that your music and your message means a lot to me.” You can only stare at him as he goes on. “It’s helped me through a lot of really dark times and I just wanted to thank you personally for all you’ve done. For me and for your other fans too.”

His words have caught you completely off-guard and you stumble over your own. “Um…you’re welcome,” you say. “I’m glad I could help you. And I hope I can continue to.”

Namjoon smiles. It’s then that you realize you’re still holding hands and you carefully drop your own from his.

“Can I tell you something a bit embarrassing?” he asks as red tinges the tips of his ears.

You stomach drops for a second. Great, now he’s going to tell you that he does something weird like sleep with a lock of your hair under his pillow or something. You’ve heard it all.

“Sure,” you say carefully and brace yourself for whatever odd fetish he’s about to disclose.

“I…kind of run a bit of a fanfic blog on tumblr. And I promised my followers I would try to see if I could get a picture with you.”

You feel relief wash over you at the confession. Fanfic is the least of your worries when it comes to your fans. It used to bother you in the past but you’ve become used to the idea of people placing you and other idols into their own stories. Sure, some—okay most—are downright vulgar but you’ve come to expect it. Being an idol has taught you to have a thick skin. In fact, you’ve spent many nights on Tumblr diving down the rabbit hole that is idol fanfic. There are actually many blogs you follow whose fics you read regularly.

You smile warmly at Namjoon and nod. “Of course I’ll take a picture with you,” you say. “I wouldn’t want to disappoint your followers.”

Namjoon’s own mouth lifts into a wide grin, revealing two deep dimples that make your heart flutter. This boy is so cute. “Would you be okay with holding up this sign I made with my blog name on it?”

“Of course!”

When he hands you the decorated piece of paper, your eyes glance down to read the name and you let out a gasp.

“No way,” you say. “You’re joonxidol?”

All color drains from Namjoon’s face and his jaw drops. It takes several seconds for him to find his voice again. “Uh…yeah,” he says.

“Oh my gosh!” you yell causing the other members and fans in line to look your way. “I’ve read all your fics!”

The boy looks terrified. “Are you serious?”

“Your serial zombie fic is amazing!” you continue. “Though a bit unrealistic if I’m being honest.” At last color returns to his skin and keeps going until he’s beet red. “I mean, I appreciate the fact that you’ve made me into such a fierce survivalist but in reality, I’d probably be the first to die. But, I mean, thanks for the vote of confidence!” Then you stiffen as you remember another of your favorites. “Oh! And your Fading Memories one shot was so beautiful. Super deep and poetic. I cried through the whole thing. I think I’ve read it like a hundred times already.”

The whole time you’re rambling on, Namjoon is staring at you in disbelief, his jaw slack and his eyes wide. When you notice this, your words begin to trail off. Crap, you broke him.

“Uh…sorry,” you apologize. “I think I got a little too excited.”

At last, Namjoon shakes his head hard. “No, no, it’s okay. I’m just—I think I’m having an out of body experience or maybe I just had a seizure or something. I thought you just said that you read my fics.”

You smile and give a sharp nod. “I do. And you’re really talented.”

“You do?” he whispers.

You nod.

“I am?”

You giggle as you pick the sign back up from where you dropped it on the table in your excitement. “Picture?” you ask him and he quickly nods before stumbling around the table to get to you.

You press your cheek against his and rest one arm on his back while the other holds the sign. Then, with a quivering hand, Namjoon holds his phone up and takes the selfie.

“Thank you so much,” he says with a huge dimpled grin.

You take his hand again and hold it between yours. “No, thank you!” you say. “Never stop writing. I look forward to reading more of your work.” Then you hold up the sign. “Can I keep this?” you ask him. He gives you a shy nod. “Would you mind signing it for me?”

Again, Namjoon’s face goes blank but then he looks down at the sharpie you hold out to him and he comes to life again.

“I’d love to,” he says and takes the pen.

You watch as he signs his name sloppily and with a shaky hand before handing it back to you.

“I’m glad to have met you, Namjoon,” you say. Your cheeks hurt from smiling so much but you can’t help it.

“You too,” he says still in a state of disbelief before he makes his way off the stage in a daze.

*****

That night, you stumble into your hotel room utterly exhausted. Nothing sounds better than a shower and a fifteen hour nap and once you’ve bathed, you settle into your king size bed. But you can’t fall asleep just yet. Instead, you pick up your phone off your nightstand. The screen glows with a harsh light and it takes a few seconds for your eyes to adjust to the brightness. Your thumb swipes across your screen until you find Tumblr App. Then you scroll through the people you follow until you find Namjoon’s blog. Your mouth twitches into a smile when you see the title of a new one shot. “Your Biggest Fan”. Then you sink deeper into your blankets and start reading.

blog.description: Ash/16/lesbian/I have three twitters for different purposes/Instagram too/ DM if you want them/so single its kinda sad/ just want a girlfriend who's cute and will top me uwu

summary: I love BTS and all, but I'm a big lesbo. My friend is attracted to both men and women and we will both freak out over them (I'm...
body:
I love BTS and all, but I’m a big lesbo. My friend is attracted to both men and women and we will both freak out over them (I’m so proud of far they’ve come!!) But hers is like

Friend: “ I want them to step on me”

Me:“I,,, wanna hug them,,,?”

Aesthetically they are attractive so the most i can give is like,,, a hug,,,,

Just thought it was funny
